definition: to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette

sentences.english: I feel tired of sending Christmas cards.
sentences.chinese: 我对寄圣诞卡已经觉得厌倦了。

sentences.english: I have received eleven Christmas cards by now.
sentences.chinese: 经收到了十一张圣诞卡片。

sentences.english: She sends me a christmas card every year without fail.
sentences.chinese: 她每年都给我寄一张圣诞卡，从无遗漏。

sentences.english: They were overstocked on Christmas cards.
sentences.chinese: 他们的圣诞卡进货过多。

sentences.english: The custom of sending Christmas cards was initiated in England around 1850.
sentences.chinese: 送圣诞卡片的风俗则是1850年左右从英格兰开始。

sentences.english: Get the students to make a card for Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 要学生制作圣诞卡，并写上祝贺词准备送给好朋友。

sentences.english: Selling Christmas cards is a kind of seasonal trades.
sentences.chinese: 出售圣诞卡是一种节令性的生意。

sentences.english: And obviously we all send out Christmas card and New Year's card at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我们还将圣诞卡和贺年卡一起发出去。

sentences.english: It didn't matter how much the christmas cards cost. I just picked up those ones that I liked.
sentences.chinese: 我专挑我喜欢的圣诞卡不管它们的价钱多少。

sentences.english: I've written to him since the game at the Madejski Stadium and I will probably send him a Christmas card.
sentences.chinese: 那场比赛后我有写信给他，我还想给他寄张圣诞卡。

sentences.english: Christmas cards and decorated trees are all over the place.
sentences.chinese: 到处都是圣诞卡和装饰过的树。

sentences.english: I'm making a Christmas card for Dad.
We treat Christmas cards a little differently.
sentences.chinese: 我们对圣诞卡的态度有点不同。

sentences.english: Exchanging gifts and sending Christmas cards are the modern ways of celebrating the Christmas in the orld.
sentences.chinese: 交换礼物和寄圣诞卡是欢度圣诞常见的方式。
